subject: CPSY
name: Honors Intro to Develop Psych
info: This course will examine normative physical, social, and cognitive development from the prenatal period through adolescence.  The major goals include fostering an understanding of the usefulness of a developmental approach to psychological issues, familiarizing students with current research and methodology in developmental psychology, and engaging students in the experiences of developmental psychology through observation and analysis of child behavior. This course is intended for University Honors Program students both within and outside of the Developmental Psych/Early Childhood programs.

subject: CPSY
name: CPsy Hon Sem
info: Acquaints students with the various research projects and activities in the Institute for Child Development and in related departments. Faculty are invited to discuss their research projects with seminar participants.prereq: CPsy honors student

subject: CPSY
name: Dir Res in Child Psych(Honors)
fullname: Directed Research in Child Psychology (Honors Thesis)
info: Individual empirical investigation. Students help plan/implement scientific studies while gaining experience/expertise in research methodology.prereq: 4 cr in CPsy, CPsy honors, instr consent, dept consent
